page.title: 15Education
page.content: Once there were two{schools}in this area, the village school at Easton and King's Worthy Primary.{The Easton {School}was opened in 1840 and was a school for 100 years until it's closure in 1968. It had two rooms for two classes and was staffed by one teacher. Now it has been made into a very compfortable private dwelling. The remaining school,{King's Worthy {Primary}has 10 classes, each with its own teacher, and caters for children aged 5-11 years. pupils learn Maths, English, Topic work and P.E. Television and computers are used in learning. Every morning, assembly is held in the hall, except Thursday morning when classes listen to a religious radio programe. Children can choose to do music and have a choice of piano, clarinet and recorders.
